subject: Fashion
title: Screen Printing Evolution
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Screen Printing Evolution.

hook.text: The graphic tee on your back uses a technique over 1,000 years old.

buildup.text: Screen printing pushes ink through a mesh stencil onto fabric below.

discovery.text: Originally from China, it spread via Japan to Europe by the 18th century.

twist.text: Andy Warhol turned screen printing into fine art with his pop icons.

climax.text: Digital printing is now replacing screens for small runs and custom designs.

punchline.text: Ancient technique, modern T-shirt. Same magic.

quiz.question: How does screen printing work?
options: Ink is sprayed from a distance
Ink is pushed through a mesh stencil onto fabric
Fabric is dipped into a dye bath
